summary: This bill, the Specialist Fourth Class Keith Smith Glioblastoma Parity Act of 2025, aims to amend Title 38 of the United States Code to provide a presumption of service connection for veterans who served in certain locations during the Vietnam era and have been diagnosed with glioblastoma multiforme. The bill outlines findings regarding Agent Orange exposure during the Vietnam War and its impact on veterans. The legislation acknowledges the health issues caused by Agent Orange exposure and aims to improve healthcare and support for affected veterans.
